intro: Alseodaphne helophila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes other aromatic trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in lowland forests and is valued for its fragrant wood. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
